p: To investigate whether the cell morphology of the stem was affected by mutations in GPAT1, the basal nodes of stems from ten-week-old WT, gpat1, gpat1-c1, and the complementation transgenic COM plants were selected and embedded in paraffin sections, followed by an analysis of their anatomical details ( Figure 5A). By measuring the cell length of longitudinal paraffin sections obtained from stems, we found that mutations in GPAT1 increased cell length significantly compared to WT plants ( Figure 5B). The alteration of cell morphology brought by a loss-of-function in GPAT1 was recovered by introducing the whole genomic sequence of the GPAT1 gene into the gpat1 mutant, which confirmed that the mutation introduced to GPAT1 significantly contributed to the alteration of the cell morphology of the stems ( Figure 5A,B). These results show that a loss of GPAT1 promotes cell elongation during stem development.
